channel.title: Which Ip do I use?
channel.description: Well I've been trying to play on a private server I downloaded for about 8 hours now. But I don't know what Ip Address I use to put into the client.java and loader.java files. Do I use my host address that I made on no-ip.com, or do I use the static ip address I made? Thanks for your help.

item.title: Which Ip do I use?
item.dc:creator: @ta1nt3d ta1nt3d
item.description:
@ta1nt3d wrote:

GL

Read full topic

It didn’t work

Thanks for your help though, wish I could rep.

item.title: Which Ip do I use?
item.dc:creator: @ta1nt3d ta1nt3d
item.description:
@ta1nt3d wrote:

serch for:if(Class68_Sub20_Sub15.ip.equals
change that whole thing to if(Class68_Sub20_Sub15.ip.equals("127.0.0.1")) {
if that doesent work i dont know how to help you

Read full topic

item.title: Which Ip do I use?
item.dc:creator: @crazyjackson2185 crazyjackson2185
item.description:
@crazyjackson2185 wrote:

[quote=“ta1nt3d, post:6, topic:374211”]please post your full client.java on www.pastebin.com
and send me link so i can have a better look[/quote]

I have two, but I think they’re the same and I don’t know which is which, or if I uploaded the same one twice.

Link 1:

http://pastebin.com/uEzG5Xuu

Link 2:

http://pastebin.com/3xvSLZSk

I really appreciate this.

Edit: The other two people who are viewing my thread right now, please post and help if you can, it’s appreciated, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Ip do I use?
item.dc:creator: @crazyjackson2185 crazyjackson2185
item.description:
@crazyjackson2185 wrote:

[quote=“ta1nt3d, post:4, topic:374211”][quote author=crazyjackson2185 link=topic=470198.msg3437783#msg3437783 date=1292887642]

are you trying to get it so other ppl can connect and play also or just so you can play?

if it is just you try using 127.0.0.1 OR 0.0.0.0 those are default[quote author=crazyjackson2185 link=topic=470198.msg3437783#msg3437783 date=1292887642]

are you trying to get it so other ppl can connect and play also or just so you can play?

if it is just you try using 127.0.0.1 OR 0.0.0.0 those are default

if trying to get it online so other can connect i suggest using www.portforward.com and selecting you router for a guide on port forwarding and what ip to use (which would probly be your static ip)

Thank you.

Edit: It is still stuck at “Connecting to Update Server” When I start the client. I have my router set up for port forwarding as far as I know. Also what was the point of me making a no-ip, I mean, what is it used for if its not set to connect to it? Sorry I’m really confused.

127.0.0.1 and 0.0.0.0 also get stuck at connecting to update server when launching the client

if trying to get it online so other can connect i suggest using www.portforward.com and selecting you router for a guide on port forwarding and what ip to use (which would probly be your static ip)
[/quote]

Thank you.

Edit: It is still stuck at “Connecting to Update Server” When I start the client. I have my router set up for port forwarding as far as I know. Also what was the point of me making a no-ip, I mean, what is it used for if its not set to connect to it? Sorry I’m really confused.

127.0.0.1 and 0.0.0.0 also get stuck at connecting to update server when launching the client
[/quote]when editing the ip of your client first of make sure what port your server is listening on make sure it is the same as you client also no-ip’s are not required its just a way of protecting your ip pretty much and it does connect say if someone is connecting to you no-ip name it then forwards their connecting to your routers ip (which hopefully is the ip you use when setting up your no-ip) you DO NOT use your static ip or dynamic ip of your cpu for your no-ip
so make sure you have it right and also make sure you have done everything correctly in your router
and in another note if you are editing you clients ip correctly to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 you most definatly should be able to connect to your server (you being the only one) but still you should be abe to log in and edit things and so on[/quote]

Everything seems to be fine and correct… I don’t know why I can not connect if what you said is right. And no I can not connect to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

The only files I need to edit are the two client.java files and the loader.java right? This is what is in my client.java code:

    Class68_Sub9.aString2883 = "127.0.0.1";

and in my loader.java code there is this:

Class68_Sub20_Sub15.ip = “127.0.0.1”;

Please help, I’ve been trying to figure this out for around 8 hours now. Very frustrated.

Read full topic

item.title: Which Ip do I use?
item.dc:creator: @ta1nt3d ta1nt3d
item.description:
@ta1nt3d wrote:

[quote=“crazyjackson2185, post:3, topic:374211”][quote author=ta1nt3d link=topic=470198.msg3437781#msg3437781 date=1292887502]
are you trying to get it so other ppl can connect and play also or just so you can play?

if it is just you try using 127.0.0.1 OR 0.0.0.0 those are default[quote author=crazyjackson2185 link=topic=470198.msg3437783#msg3437783 date=1292887642]

are you trying to get it so other ppl can connect and play also or just so you can play?

if it is just you try using 127.0.0.1 OR 0.0.0.0 those are default

if trying to get it online so other can connect i suggest using www.portforward.com and selecting you router for a guide on port forwarding and what ip to use (which would probly be your static ip)

Thank you.

Edit: It is still stuck at “Connecting to Update Server” When I start the client. I have my router set up for port forwarding as far as I know. Also what was the point of me making a no-ip, I mean, what is it used for if its not set to connect to it? Sorry I’m really confused.

127.0.0.1 and 0.0.0.0 also get stuck at connecting to update server when launching the client
[/quote]

if trying to get it online so other can connect i suggest using www.portforward.com and selecting you router for a guide on port forwarding and what ip to use (which would probly be your static ip)
[/quote]

Thank you.

Edit: It is still stuck at “Connecting to Update Server” When I start the client. I have my router set up for port forwarding as far as I know. Also what was the point of me making a no-ip, I mean, what is it used for if its not set to connect to it? Sorry I’m really confused.

127.0.0.1 and 0.0.0.0 also get stuck at connecting to update server when launching the client[/quote]when editing the ip of your client first of make sure what port your server is listening on make sure it is the same as you client also no-ip’s are not required its just a way of protecting your ip pretty much and it does connect say if someone is connecting to you no-ip name it then forwards their connecting to your routers ip (which hopefully is the ip you use when setting up your no-ip) you DO NOT use your static ip or dynamic ip of your cpu for your no-ip
so make sure you have it right and also make sure you have done everything correctly in your router
and in another note if you are editing you clients ip correctly to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 you most definatly should be able to connect to your server (you being the only one) but still you should be abe to log in and edit things and so on

Read full topic
